intro: Scholtzia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with thick, fleshy leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Scholtzia obovata is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
